Bash(~/.claude/statusline-command.sh << 'SCRIPT_EOF'
#!/bin/bash

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$\(cat\)

# Extract model display name
model_name=$\(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model.display_name // "Claude"'\)

# Extract context usage percentage \(used_percentage\)
used_pct=$\(echo "$input" | jq -r '.context_window.used_percentage // empty'\)

# If no messages yet, show default state
if [ -z "$used_pct" ]; then
    printf "%s | Context: --" "$model_name"
    exit 0
fi

# Round to integer
used_pct_int=$\(printf "%.0f" "$used_pct"\)

# Create progress bar \(20 characters wide\)
bar_width=20
filled=$\(printf "%.0f" "$\(echo "scale=2; $used_pct / 5" | bc\)"\)
[ "$filled" -lt 0 ] && filled=0
[ "$filled" -gt "$bar_width" ] && filled=$bar_width

empty=$\(\(bar_width - filled\)\)

# Build the bar
bar=""
for \(\(i=0; i<filled; i++\)\); do bar="${bar}█"; done
for \(\(i=0; i<empty; i++\)\); do bar="${bar}░"; done

# Color coding based on usage
if [ "$used_pct_int" -ge 80 ]; then
    color="\\033[31m"  # Red
elif [ "$used_pct_int" -ge 60 ]; then
    color="\\033[33m"  # Yellow
else
    color="\\033[32m"  # Green
fi
reset="\\033[0m"

# Output status line
printf "${color}%s${reset} | Context: ${color}[%s] %d%%${reset}" "$model_name" "$bar" "$used_pct_int"
SCRIPT_EOF)
